name.us: Sega Vintage Collection: Toe Jam & Earl
Red Johnson’s Chronicles: One Against All
name.uk: Red Johnson’s Chronicles: One Against All

description: We're happy the series has finally found a home on the PS3. Gundam fans will be delighted by the huge selection of mechs, but even casual fans of the genre will want to have a look at this one.
Riders on superbikes racing around tracks at high speed.
Budget-priced and endearingly original, Rock of the Dead simply drags on a bit too long to stay as fresh as its premise.
SBK X remains a niche product, though if you’ve signed on for racing lines over powerslides, you’ll easily get your money’s worth here.
Based on the upcoming 3D, animated film featuring the voice of Steve Carell, it focuses on the misadventures of the the no. 1 super villain on the earth.
Based on the popular kids show and card game, this action-RPG expands the show's universe with a plot by writers from the TV series.

It's a game that you can play for free in your browser, and it even comes preloaded on many cell phones. Despite that, Hudson is hoping some fancy graphics and some neat multiplayer options will rekindle folks' interest in this PSN game.
A fast-paced, party game take on the old game of billiards for PSN.

Let your past catch up with you in this new PlayStation Network puzzle offering. Echochrono introduces "self co-op" (playing with your past/history), while bringing a fun and different twist to the puzzle genre.

name.us: The Lord of the Rings: Aragorn's Quest
name.uk: The Lord of the Rings: Aragorn's Quest

description: Worms 2 is every Worms, all at once, and the best Worms ever. Team 17 have given you the tools to make this XBLA/PSN game what you want but made sure you needn’t be at the mercy of Concrete Donkey-dropping idiots in every online game.

name.us: Sam & Max Beyond Time and Space
name.uk: Sam & Max Beyond Time and Space

description: Based on the Bakugan animated TV series and toy line, Bakugan promises intense battles, the ability to create your own brawler, cartoon quality graphics and multiplayer combat.
Based on the popular television game show, this game has you trying your luck on a spinning wheel in HD!
Currently a Xbox 360 exclusive.

As the Dreamworks Animation machine releases another money collector on film, so too must a game be made for that property. Thus lurches another empty exercise filled with dull celebrity voices and simple gameplay. It will then sell a million copies.

name.us: Karaoke Revolution Presents: American Idol Encore 2
name.uk: Karaoke Revolution Presents: American Idol Encore 2

description: In case you missed it the first time, here's another chance to face the scorn of a digital Simon Cowell. With over 40 songs to butcher, more scheduled for PS3 and 360 exclusive downloadable content, and an even more accurately rendered version of the Idol judges, there's been no better chance to make up for when you were just too chicken to go audition for real. Owners of the original game will be able to download their old songs into the new version.

EA SPORTS has turned fantasy football into a (slightly) more interactive experience with some new in-game interaction with Madden NFL 09. Play your fantasy team against other created teams in online head-to-head games.

A 3rd person action adventure that has you leading three sexy female witches into battle against an evil beast that's caused a reign of slavery and terror to spread throughout the land. We're imagining Charmed crossed with Lord of the Rings.
A survey of the most preposterous cheats in gaming history
A simple cube swapping puzzler that will be available for download on the PS3. Did we mention the cube swapping?
The by the numbers puzzle franchise goes next-gen. Download up to 1000 puzzles and engage in some 4-player fun.
Assault Heroes for PSN puts you behind the wheel of a couple different assault vehicles - a land-based buggy and a water-based gunship - and then gives you more than enough things to shoot at.

There was a time where nearly any cute-ish animal could get his own trilogy of video games, costarring with real-life buxom blondes and saving the world from despicable evils. That time, sadly, has passed.

name.us: Alone in the Dark: The New Nightmare
name.uk: Alone in the Dark: The New Nightmare

description: Karaoke Revolution lets karaoke fans sing and compete against friends with expanded multiplayer modes, 50 all-new hit songs from master recordings, as well as 16 original customizable venues and newly enhanced customizable characters including facial and body morphing.

name.us: Dragon Ball Z: Battle of Z
name.uk: Dragon Ball Z: Battle of Z

name.us: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon because I Don't Know
name.uk: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon because I Don't Know

name.us: Magic The Gathering - Duels of the Planeswalkers 2014
name.uk: Magic The Gathering - Duels of the Planeswalkers 2014

name.uk: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Legendary Edition

name.uk: Metal Gear Solid: The Legacy Collection

name.uk: Final Fantasy X / X-2 HD Remaster

name.uk: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows

name.uk: Atelier Ayesha: The Alchemist of Twilight Land

name.us: Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons
name.uk: Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons

name.us: Fist of the North Star: Ken's Rage 2
name.uk: Fist of the North Star: Ken's Rage 2

name.us: Final Fantasy XIV Online: A Realm Reborn
name.uk: Final Fantasy XIV Online: A Realm Reborn

description: Call of Juarez: The Gunslinger brings the action back to the Wild West with a series of tales surrounding legends of the era, such as Billy the Kid and Pat Garrett.

name.us: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain
Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
name.uk: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse

name.us: Army of Two: The Devil's Cartel
name.uk: Army of Two: The Devil's Cartel

name.us: Ice Age: Continental Drift – Arctic Games
name.uk: Ice Age: Continental Drift – Arctic Games

name.us: Magic The Gathering - Duels of the Planeswalkers 2013
name.uk: Magic The Gathering - Duels of the Planeswalkers 2013

name.us: Zone of the Enders HD Collection
name.uk: Zone of the Enders HD Collection

name.us: Dark Souls: Prepare to Die Edition
name.uk: Dark Souls: Prepare to Die Edition

name.us: Atelier Meruru: The Apprentice of Arland
name.uk: Atelier Meruru: The Apprentice of Arland

name.us: London 2012: The official video game of the Olympic Games
name.uk: London 2012: The official video game of the Olympic Games

name.us: Penny Arcade Adventures: On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness, Episode Three
name.uk: Penny Arcade Adventures: On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness, Episode Three

name.us: The Witch and the Hundred Knights
name.uk: The Witch and the Hundred Knights

name.us: Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning: The Legend of Dead Kel
name.uk: Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning: The Legend of Dead Kel

name.us: Disney Epic Mickey 2: The Power of Two
name.uk: Disney Epic Mickey 2: The Power of Two

name.us: Hell Yeah! Wrath of the Dead Rabbit
name.uk: Hell Yeah! Wrath of the Dead Rabbit

description: Sequel to the awesome gritty RPG The Witcher.

If you like the idea of flying a cool-looking helicopter in a 2D action game that makes you think, Choplifter HD is totally worth checking out, but you'll need a lot of patience to make it through the whole thing.

Between its unique weapons – it gives “live ammo” a new definition – and wildly varying boss battles, Stanger’s Wrath deserved a better fate when it originally launched. The HD remake breathes new life into it, and the results are terrific.

name.us: South Park: The Stick of Truth
name.uk: South Park: The Stick of Truth

description: It doesn’t matter how cheap it is. Leave this uninspired rail-shooter in the bargain bin where it belongs.

name.us: Cartoon Network: Punch Time Explosion XL
name.uk: Cartoon Network: Punch Time Explosion XL

description: The biggest franchise in gaming is back
In this standalone DLC, Cole MacGrath has one night to save his own soul after a vampire bites him (and gives him a bunch of new powers in the process).

name.us: Leisure Suit Larry In The Land Of The Lounge Lizards HD
name.uk: Leisure Suit Larry In The Land Of The Lounge Lizards HD

name.us: Runner 2: Future Legend of Rhythm Alien
name.uk: BIT.TRIP Presents: Runner 2, Future Legend of Rhythm Alien

description: PixelJunk 4am is a music creation suite for PlayStation Network that utilizes the Move controller to let you build and layer tracks by pulling sounds from the space around your TV.
If you’ve got free time and ten bucks to spare, Rochard is worth its weight in unobtanium. Or any other implausible space rock for that matter.
What We Say: Resident Evil 4 is as fun as it's ever been, but the half-hearted attention given to updating the visuals make this a must-have title only for those who have never played it before.

Rarely have we had such a love/hate relationship with a sports game as Grand Slam 2, which can be great (the online play rocks) and bizarre (a strange Career mode) at the same time. A terrific historical mode helps save the day, but there’s plenty more we would have loved to see.
Looks a bit like Paper Mario. But with less Goombas. And more blood.

name.us: The Adventures of Tintin: The Game
name.uk: The Adventures of Tintin: The Game

description: The Adventures of Tintin is short, repetitive, and easy, but somehow that doesn't mean it's bad.

Medieval Moves: Deadmund's Quest borrows familiar actions from Sports Champions to deliver a Move-enabled, on-rails adventure in which you'll battle skeleton foes with a sword, throwing stars, and arrows.

What We Say: An old-school shoot-em-up with unique hand-drawn visuals and a voice-acted soundtrack breathes life into a classic genre. Tough bosses, frenetic battles, and a wide variety of power-ups makes Scribble Shooter shine; too bad you have to log into Home to play it.

name.us: Phineas and Ferb Across the 2nd Dimension
name.uk: Phineas and Ferb Across the 2nd Dimension

description: If you’re over twelve years old and/or don’t eat crayons, you probably won't much care for Phineas and Ferb’s first console outing. If you have spawned small offspring, however, it might be a budget title worth picking up. See, in a world where children's shows are overflowing with bratty (wizard) divas, Phineas and Ferb embodies politeness and creativity.
Mercury Hg does accomplish what it sets out to do: provide a few hours of breezy racing and puzzling set to some thumping beats.

name.us: Marvel Super Hero Squad: Comic Combat
name.uk: Marvel Super Hero Squad: Comic Combat

description: Sideway: New York combines a unique graffiti aesthetic with solid 2D gameplay for a downloadable adventure that’s worth experiencing, despite its short length.
The Awesome Summer Minis Bundle collects five bite-sized PSP/PS3 games – including the stellar A Space Shooter for Two Bucks! – but the self-aggrandizing title doesn't apply to much of what's here.

name.us: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm Generations
name.uk: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm Generations

description: Small developers looking to create old-style 2D games that are difficult should study PixelJunk SideScroller as a template: it has responsive controls, non-punishing checkpoints, and intuitively-flowing level design even as it throws serious danger at the player constantly.

2K Sports has achieved the seemingly impossible – improving on last year’s tour de force. Eschewing the focus on individual play by emphasizing team fundamentals, NBA 2K12 is a crowning achievement. Between the compelling historic modes to a vastly improved My Player and an Online Association, 2K12 is our newest obsession. This one is going to last awhile.

name.us: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Future Soldier
name.uk: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Future Soldier

description: Ghost Recon travels forward to near-future weapons and skirmishes.

Even if you plan to play only one of the three stealth action classics in this graphically-upgraded collection – which includes 2001’s Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty, 2004’s Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater, and 2010’s Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker, along with a handful of fun extras – this compilation is still a real bargain.

The game is clearly cobbled together from the brilliant ideas of other co-op games (well, mostly Left 4 Dead), but nowhere else will you find that endorphin-rush mixed with tense anxiety that your fantasies of bank robbery conjure up.

name.us: The House of the Dead: OVERKILL Extended Cut
name.uk: The House of the Dead: OVERKILL Extended Cut

description: One of the Wii's finest, goriest arcade adventures (and one of the sweariest games in history) gets a retooled PS3 special edition, with support for Move, 3D, and whole whole extra scenarios.

name.us: Atelier Totori: The Adventurer of Arland
name.uk: Atelier Totori: The Adventurer of Arland

description: The adventures of Captain Price's moustache continue
This sequel to Warhawk is set in space and features a real-time building system as you fight on land and in the skies.

Welcome back to the stage of history. Set 17 years after the events in Soul Calibur IV, Soul Calibur V will boast a fighting roster of 20-30 characters, half of which will be brand new. Namco Bandai wants the latest release of Soul Calibur to be “faster, lighter, and more elegant.”

It’s possible Need for Speed The Run won’t provide as many hours of entertainment as previous NFS games, but then it packs in unique events and some incredibly exciting chase sequences, meaning it packs a lot of entertainment-per-hour. It’s not very forgiving of mistakes, but then it provides greater rewards as a result. Whereas MotorStorm: Apocalypse might have overdone it with the setpieces, The Run balances blockbuster style with meat-and-potatoes racing for a well-rounded mix.
Rio suffers from some flimsy charm in spots and a few weak minigames, but it distinguishes itself as a suitably entertaining party game that's quite appropriate for its target audience.

Sizzling, innovative guitar technology that sits on top of a tired formula makes Rocksmith a tough call. It’s undeniably fun in many ways, especially with the range of songs and sounds we tinkered with. Unfortunately, the main game mode is hard to be excited about, since that formula has been beaten to death.
Moon Diver is a flashy, fun arcade action game that’s a crazy multiplayer romp or a super challenging single-player experience – but never both.

name.us: Super Street Fighter IV Arcade Edition
name.uk: Super Street Fighter IV Arcade Edition

description: An agonizing experience that you should never, ever play.
What may work great on the small screen loses all of its charm when splayed across a 47” LCD screen.
Play as Umbrella operatives in this bleak and violent return to Raccoon City with squad-based gameplay and... Leon and Claire as targets?

While 2K’s pro hoops counterpart blew the doors off the sports sim landscape this year, their baseball game jogs on a treadmill. Lacking any substantial new modes or features, MLB 2K11 is fun but somewhat uninspiring.

As you’d expect, MLB 11 The Show is a marvel. Pitch-perfect presentation, superb realism, and an upgraded Road To The Show make this a no-brainer for PS3 sports fans. However, thanks to the Jordan Effect, we’re left a little wanting by what’s not there, even if everything in the package is top notch.
This repetitive game is repetitively repetitive. Keep your distance.

name.us: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell Classic Trilogy HD
name.uk: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell Classic Trilogy HD

description: For those stuck to an incredibly limited budget, this game supplies all of the common multiplayer tropes you’d see in any $60 FPS for only $8.

Assuming you will yourself to learn its nuances – because it sure doesn’t teach you - Alive offers a solid combination of racing depth and variety. A great starting price, strong online offerings (eventually), a decent amount of tracks and vehicles, and a non-traditional XP progression path help offset ordinary visuals and meager resources for newbies.
At its core, Virtua Tennis 4 remains a game that can be casually enjoyed by anyone, but feels outdated and even unresponsive at times.
